Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so please before making such alarmist statements, make sure you are correct, or you become the one that cries wolf

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: CC have total control over the inputs and outputs. and arbitrary C code that validates, it is extremely unlikely that even a gross design flaw cannot be fixed and most things are just missing validations. now without the normal vin, it would indeed be impossible, but we are allowed to modify the tx in question

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: CC is still new to you and I remember at first, I had those moments too, when I thought it just wont work in a CC

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: but so far, always, there has been a solution, to the point where entire rogue gameplay is fed into validation

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: and i am also fiddling with realtime user events that will go into the validation, so over time I went from not really understanding what CC can do, to where I am now, where my assumption is that CC can do it, just a matter to figure out how

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: once I started thinking of validation as "what do I need to add to the tx in order to be able to validate efficiently" things became easier. dont view the tx as unchangeable

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: like when we found we needed the txidpk in the payments CC validation, it wasnt there and there was no opreturn... so we just make a new vout with txidpk in it
